text: hey everyone today I'm showing you a
quick fix for a holiday conundrum that I
know a lot of people have and that is
chilling your white wine or your
champagne down as quickly as you
possibly can for all of those holiday
guests it's a really simple trick and
I'm going to show you how to do it so I
have an ice bucket here and there's
about mmm I would say 2 to 3 trays of
ice cubes in the bottom of this ice
bucket and to that I'm going to add
water the water helps to dissolve our
secret ingredient and also it breaks up
the ice cubes a little bit so we can fit
that white wine or champagne into our
ice bucket so now the secret ingredient
is just salt and what salt does is it
lowers the freezing point of the water
it goes below freezing and will help to
chill your champagne or your white wine
even faster so I'm adding about 6
tablespoons of salt into this you want
to do about 3 tablespoons of salt per
ice cube tray that you use and enough
water to kind of break up the ice cubes
and dissolve the salt and I'm just going
to give this a quick stir and then
you're ready for your champagne or your
white wine you might need a little bit
more water really need the surface area
around the bottle to be covered in that
icy water so there you have it a super
simple and easy trick in chilling your
white wine or your champagne down in
half the time so now when your holiday
guests come over with that bottle of
wine you can chill it down kitchen
conundrum solved
